intro: Pilosella obscuripes, commonly known as the dark hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name, and it typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Pilosella obscuripes produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soils.
